title: Obstructions in Fairways Act, 1881
description: Official consolidated text of Obstructions in Fairways Act, 1881 (XVI of 1881) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title. This Act may be called the Obstructions in Fairways Act 1881;
provisions.content:
3
*      *           *         *            *          *          *
But nothing herein contained shall apply to vessels 4[belonging to, or hired by a contract made
on behalf of, the 5[Government]].

provisions.title: Section 2. Federal Government empowered to remove or destroy obstruction in fairway
provisions.content:
Whenever, in any fairway leading to any port in 2[Pakistan], any vessel is sunk, stranded or abandoned,
or any fishing-stake, timber of other thing is placed or left, 6[the 7[Federal Government]] may, if in its
opinion such thing is, or is likely to become, an obstruction or danger to navigation,-
(a)        cause such thing or any part thereof to be removed; or
if such thing is of such a description or so situate that, 9[in the opinion of the
(b)
7
[Federal Government]], it is not worth removing, cause the same or any part
thereof to be destroyed.

provisions.title: Section 3. Federal Government entitled to expenses incurred in removing obstruction. Whenever
provisions.content:
anything is removed under section 2, 10[the 7[Federal Government]] shall be entitled to receive a
reasonable sum, having regard to all the circumstances of the case, for the expenses incurred in
respect of such removal.
Dispute concerning such expenses. Any dispute arising concerning the amount due under this
section, in respect of anything so removed, shall be decided by the District Magistrate 8* * * having
jurisdiction at the place where such thing is, upon application to him for that purpose by either of the
disputing parties; and such decision shall be final.

provisions.title: Section 4. Notice of removal to be given by Federal Government. The 1[Federal Government] shall,
provisions.content:
whenever anything is removed under section 2, publish in the 2[official Gazette] a notification
containing a description of such thing, and the time at which and the place from which the same was
so removed.

provisions.title: Section 5. Things removed may, in certain cases, be sold. If, after publishing such notification, such
provisions.content:
thing is unclaimed, or if the person claiming the same fails to pay the amount due for the said expenses
and any customs-duties or other charges properly incurred by the 1[Federal Government] in respect
thereof,
the 1[Federal Government] may sell such thing by public auction, if it is of a perishable nature,
forthwith, and, if it is not of a perishable nature, at any time not less than six months after publishing
such notification as aforesaid.

provisions.title: Section 6. Proceeds how applied. On realizing the proceeds of such sale, the amount due for expenses
provisions.content:
and charges as aforesaid, together with the expenses of the sale, shall be deducted therefrom, and the
surplus (if any) shall be paid to the owner of the thing sold, or, if no such person appear and claim such
surplus, shall be held in deposit for payment, without interest, to any person thereafter establishing his
right to the same:
Provided that he makes the claim within one year from the date of the sale.

provisions.title: Section 7. “Vessel” to include tackle, cargo, etc. For the purposes of this Act, the term “vessel” shall
provisions.content:
be deemed to include also every article or thing or collection of things being or forming part of the
tackle, equipment, cargo, stores or ballast of a vessel; and any proceeds arising from the sale of a
vessel, and of the cargo thereof, or of any other property recovered therefrom, shall be regarded as a
common fund.

provisions.title: Section 8. Power to make rules to regulate and prohibit the placing of obstructions in fairways
provisions.content:
The [Federal Government] may, from time to time, by notification in the 4[official Gazette], make
3
rules to regulate or prohibit, in any fairway leading to a port in 5[Pakistan], the placing of fishing-
stakes, the casting or throwing of ballast, rubbish or any other thing likely to give rise to a bank or
shoal, or the doing of any other act which will in 6[its] opinion, cause, or be likely to cause, obstruction
or danger to navigation.

provisions.title: Section 9. Penalty for breach of such rules. Whoever is guilty of any act or omission in contravention
provisions.content:
of the rules made under section 8 may be tried for such offence in any district7* * * in which he is
found, and shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with
fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

provisions.title: Section 10. Compensation payable in certain cases for damage caused under this Act. Whenever
provisions.content:
the maintenance or creation of an obstruction in any fairway has become lawful by long usage or
otherwise, and such obstruction is removed or destroyed under section 2, or its creation is regulated or
prohibited under section 8, any person having a right to maintain or create such obstruction shall be
entitled to receive from the 1[Federal Government] reasonable compensation for any damage caused
to him by such removal, destruction, regulation or prohibition.
Every dispute arising concerning the right to such compensation, or the amount thereof, shall
be determined according to the law for the time being in force relating to like disputes in the case of
land needed for public purposes2 and not otherwise ; and for the purposes of such law the fairway from
or in which such obstruction was removed or destroyed, or in which its creation was regulated or
prohibited, shall be deemed to be a part of the 3* * * district in which the port to which such fairway
leads is situated.

provisions.title: Section 11. Certain action of the Government previous to passing of this Act be deemed to have
provisions.content:
been taken hereunder. Whenever any obstruction in a fairway leading to a port in 4[Pakistan] has
been removed or destroyed, or whenever the creation of any such obstruction has been regulated or
prohibited, by an order of the 1[Federal Government] or a 5[Provincial Government], previous to the
passing of this Act, such removal, destruction, regulation or prohibition shall be deemed to have been
effected under this Act.

provisions.title: Section 12. Saving of other powers possessed by Federal Government. Nothing herein contained
provisions.content:
shall be deemed to prevent the exercise by 6[the 1[Federal Government]] of any other powers possessed
by it in this behalf.
7[13. Application to fairways in inland waterways. All references in this Act to the 1[Federal
Government] shall, in relation to fairways in inland waterways, be construed as references to the
Provincial Government concerned.]
